Project Name: Sales (Ephraim) Collection of Interviews by Roy Newquist
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Description.note: The first recording file is a rough-cut interview with publisher Leon Shimkin. He discusses the landscape and ethics of publishing and its history in the United States.|~|L. Shimkin - Box 7 #95
Format.extent: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape
Title: Unaired Interview with Publisher Leon Shimkin Side A

Project Name: Sales (Ephraim) Collection of Interviews by Roy Newquist
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Description.note: The second recording file is a continuation of an interview with publisher Leon Shimkin.|~|L. Shimkin - Box 7 #95
Format.extent: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape
Title: Unaired Interview with Publisher Leon Shimkin Side B

Project Name: Sales (Ephraim) Collection of Interviews by Roy Newquist
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Description.note: The recording begins with what seems to be notes from Roy Newquist about having talked to Frank Sinatra. The remainder appears to be the Gene Smith Counterpoint broadcast.|~|Gene Smith - Box 13 #195
Format.extent: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape
Title: Counterpoint: Gene Smith Side A

Project Name: Sales (Ephraim) Collection of Interviews by Roy Newquist
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Description.note: The second recording (side 2) contains a copy of the latter part of the first recording (without the Frank Sinatra notes). In the interview with Gene Smith, he talks about his biography with President Wilson, and his methods for writing the book. Smith also provides some anecdotes about President Wilson.|~|Gene Smith - Box 13 #195
Format.extent: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape
Title: Counterpoint: Gene Smith Side B
